awd_titl_txt: Efficient HDL Modeling and Presynthesis Optimizations for Embedded Systems
awd_abstract_narration: The goal of this research is to develop algoithms and tools for modeling hardware and software using a high-level programming language, or an HDL, and use it to develop algorithms for language-level "presynthesis" optimizations.  Research activities being carried out under this grant include: (a) indentify semantic support for modeling reactive and structural components in a high-level language that preserves synthesizability of the resulting description; (b) explore the nature of the Don't Care (DC) information an design assertions that are used to optimize an HDL description; develop appropriate models to capture the DC information; (c) develop a tabular model of system behavior called. Timed Decision Tables (TDTs); (d) use TDT model transformations to restructure and rewrite HDL code for improved synthesis results.  The research results are being used to develop a framework for language-level exploration and optimization of design alternatives for microelectronic systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

pgm_ele.pgm_ele_name: DES AUTO FOR MICRO & NANO SYS
